channel.title: NYTimes Filtered
channel.description: Filtered news feed based on specified categories.

item.title: E.P.A. Offers a Way to Avoid Clean-Air Rules: Send an Email
item.description: Referring to a little-known provision, it said power plants and others could write to seek exemptions to mercury and other restrictions and that “the president will make a decision.”
item.author: Hiroko Tabuchi
item.content:encoded: A coal-burning power plant in Colorado in 2023. The Biden administration had put new rules in place on emissions from power plants.

item.title: Tomb of Unknown Pharaoh Is Unearthed in Egypt
item.description: The burial chamber most likely belonged to a ruler in a line of kings once lost to history, researchers said. “It’s a new chapter in investigating this dynasty,” one noted.
item.author: Alan Yuhas

item.title: Is Boogie Fland the Next Legendary New York City Point Guard?
item.description: In some ways, the prodigy now starring for Arkansas in the N.C.A.A. tournament is an urban basketball archetype. But this is not the same old story.
item.author: David Waldstein
item.content:encoded: Boogie Fland, a highly touted freshman from New York, recovered from surgery just in time to help the Arkansas Razorbacks make a run in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

item.title: Jazzed About Abstraction: Jack Whitten’s Show Is a Peak MoMA Moment
item.description: Over nearly six decades, this fantastically inventive artist experimented with paint, turning it into a sculptural medium. Our critic calls his survey “scintillating and sweeping.”
item.author: Holland Cotter
item.content:encoded: Jack Whitten, “9.11.01” (2006), a 20-foot-long memorial to the destruction of the World Trade Center on 9/11, an event that he witnessed firsthand.

item.title: How to Have a Passionate Life
item.description: A surprising route to the best life possible.
item.author: David Brooks

item.title: David M. Childs, Architect of 1 World Trade Center, Dies at 83
item.description: The antithesis of a “starchitect,” he didn’t have a recognizable style. But as a partner at Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, he helped transform the New York skyline.
item.author: David W. Dunlap
item.content:encoded: Mr. Childs with a scale model of 1 World Trade Center in 2006.

item.title: Opinion | How to Have a Passionate Life
item.description: A surprising route to the best life possible.
item.author: David Brooks

item.title: Tomb of Unknown Pharaoh Is Unearthed in Egypt
item.description: The burial chamber most likely belonged to a ruler in a line of kings once lost to history, researchers said. “It’s a new chapter in investigating this dynasty.”
item.author: Alan Yuhas

item.title: RFK Jr. Turns to a Discredited Vaccine Researcher for Autism Study
item.description: David Geier has been hired as a senior data analyst at H.H.S. According to several people, he will examine any potential links between vaccines and autism that were debunked long ago.
item.author: Christina Jewett, Emily Baumgaertner Nunn and Sheryl Gay Stolberg
item.content:encoded: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the health secretary, at the U.S. Capitol in March. Mr. Kennedy has long held that there is a link between certain vaccines and autism.

item.title: What to Know About Adderall, Ritalin and Other Prescription Stimulants
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has called them poison, but doctors say prescription stimulants like Ritalin and Adderall help millions of people.
item.author: Christina Caron

item.title: Senate Confirms Bhattacharya and Makary to H.H.S. Posts
item.description: Dr. Jay Bhattacharya will direct the N.I.H., and Dr. Martin A. Makary will lead the F.D.A. Both have reputations as medical contrarians.
item.author: Benjamin Mueller

item.title: Dementia May Not Always Be the Threat It Is Now. Here’s Why.
item.description: The number of cases will increase, but the rates seem to be declining with every birth cohort that reaches advanced ages, researchers said.
item.author: Paula Span
